title: Charges filed in fatal Wichita shooting
content:
A 22-year-old Wichita man has been charged with involuntary manslaughter for a fatal shooting death last week.
Jacob Pulliam made his first appearance in Sedgwick County District Court on Tuesday. He is scheduled for a preliminary hearing on May 10th.
Pulliam was arrested after 19-year-old Mekko Stumblingbear was found dead April 22nd in a home in the 1800 block of West McCormick. Officers originally thought the death was a suicide, but they learned that several other people had been in the home. Detectives found that someone had picked up a rifle, and a shot was fired. Pulliam was taken into custody a few hours later.
